alert.note: Alert for Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 5:53PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Throckmorton County through 645 PM CST... At 553 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222, or near Irby, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elbert and Us-183 Near The Throckmorton-Baylor County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
